Docs.summary: This attribute is used to expose internal methods to another assembly.

remarks.para: This is an assembly-level attribute that is used to expose the internal types and members to another assembly. This makes everything that might have been flagged as "internal" visible as a public member to the assembly referenced.
If you have a public key (the .pub file used to sign an assembly): use the following command to extract the Public Key):

example.code:
mono$ sn -tp /cvs/moon/class/silverlight.pub Mono StrongName - version 1.9.0.0 StrongName utility for signing assemblies Copyright 2002, 2003 Motus Technologies. Copyright 2004-2008 Novell. BSD licensed.
Public Key: 00240000048000009400000006020000002400005253413100040000010001008d56c76f9e8649 383049f383c44be0ec204181822a6c31cf5eb7ef486944d032188ea1d3920763712ccb12d75fb7 7e9811149e6148e5d32fbaab37611c1878ddc19e20ef135d0cb2cff2bfec3d115810c3d9069638 fe4be215dbf795861920e5ab6f7db2e2ceef136ac23d5dd2bf031700aec232f6c6b1c785b4305c 123b37ab
Public Key Token: 7cec85d7bea7798e

remarks.para: Use this key then as the PublicKey value inside the string:

example.code: // This attribute makes the internal methods available to the Mono.Moonlight assembly. [assembly: InternalsVisibleTo ("Mono.Moonlight, PublicKey=002400000480000094000000060200000024000052534131000400000100010079159977d2d03a8e6bea7a2e74e8d1afcc93e8851974952bb480a12c913 4474d04062447c37e0e68c080536fcf3c3fbe2ff9c979ce998475e506e8ce82dd5b0f350dc10e93bf2eeecf874b24770c5081dbea7447fddafa277b22de47d6ffea449674a4f9fccf84d15069089380284dbdd35f46cdff12a1bd78e4ef00 65d016df")]

Docs.param: The assembly name, this must include the Public Key. See the class documentation for an example.
Docs.remarks: Allows the specified assembly to have access to the internal classes and members of this assembly.
